item.title: For safety critical applications like robotic surgery and autonomous driving, we want a model to be able to quantify the uncertainty associated with its prediction. Calibration characterizes how good a model is at yielding output scores corresponding to the true posteriors. 2/12
item.description: For safety critical applications like robotic surgery and autonomous driving, we want a model to be able to quantify the uncertainty associated with its prediction. Calibration characterizes how good a model is at yielding output scores corresponding to the true posteriors. 2/12
item.content:encoded: For safety critical applications like robotic surgery and autonomous driving, we want a model to be able to quantify the uncertainty associated with its prediction. Calibration characterizes how good a model is at yielding output scores corresponding to the true posteriors. 2/12

item.title: Deepnets and random forests are often overconfident or poorly calibrated while predicting for a class label, i.e., their predicted confidence scores are concentrated around 0 or 1. 3/12

item.title: We conceptualize both Deepnets (DN) and Random Forest (RF) as generalized partitioning rules with an affine function learned over each partition or polytope of the feature space. 7/12
item.description: We conceptualize both Deepnets (DN) and Random Forest (RF) as generalized partitioning rules with an affine function learned over each partition or polytope of the feature space. 7/12
item.content:encoded: We conceptualize both Deepnets (DN) and Random Forest (RF) as generalized partitioning rules with an affine function learned over each partition or polytope of the feature space. 7/12

item.title: We replace the affine function over each polytope populated by the training data with a Gaussian kernel learned using the training data and prune the unpopulated polytopes. We call the proposed approach Kernel Generative Forest (KGF) and Kernel Generative Network (KGN). 8/12
item.description: We replace the affine function over each polytope populated by the training data with a Gaussian kernel learned using the training data and prune the unpopulated polytopes. We call the proposed approach Kernel Generative Forest (KGF) and Kernel Generative Network (KGN). 8/12
item.content:encoded: We replace the affine function over each polytope populated by the training data with a Gaussian kernel learned using the training data and prune the unpopulated polytopes. We call the proposed approach Kernel Generative Forest (KGF) and Kernel Generative Network (KGN). 8/12

item.title: ü•º The collaboration to create iGluSnFR3 began when @abhi_aggarwal1 came to Janelia in 2019 as a Janelia Undergraduate Scholar. @PodgorskiLab, who was a Janelia Fellow, had recently embarked on a project to devise a genetically encoded indicator to measure glutamate. (2/9)

item.content:encoded: ü•º The collaboration to create iGluSnFR3 began when @abhi_aggarwal1 came to Janelia in 2019 as a Janelia Undergraduate Scholar. @PodgorskiLab, who was a Janelia Fellow, had recently embarked on a project to devise a genetically encoded indicator to measure glutamate. (2/9)

item.title: üß† Glutamate is one of the most important and abundant neurotransmitters in the brain. Being able to see and measure glutamate could help scientists understand how neurons communicate and transform inputs into outputs to perform computations. (3/9)

item.title: üß™ Glutamate indicators had been developed & enhanced by former Janelia Group Leader @LoogerL & Senior Scientist Jonathan Marvin. But these sensors had not yet been optimized for measuring glutamate entering a synapse & illuminated glutamate in other parts of the cell. (4/9)
item.description: üß™ Glutamate indicators had been developed & enhanced by former Janelia Group Leader @LoogerL & Senior Scientist Jonathan Marvin. But these sensors had not yet been optimized for measuring glutamate entering a synapse & illuminated glutamate in other parts of the cell. (4/9)
item.content:encoded: üß™ Glutamate indicators had been developed & enhanced by former Janelia Group Leader @LoogerL & Senior Scientist Jonathan Marvin. But these sensors had not yet been optimized for measuring glutamate entering a synapse & illuminated glutamate in other parts of the cell. (4/9)
